title: Energy conservation in a mass and spring system

content.description: A block of mass <math alttext="m equals 0.20 kilogram" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.20</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>kg</mi></math> is attached to a spring of spring constant <math alttext="lowercase k equals 30 newtons per meter" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mi>k</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>30</mn> <mspace width="0.2em"> </mspace> <mtext>N/m</mtext> </mstyle> </math> and placed on a horizontal surface. The block is pulled to the right to a position <math alttext="x equals 0.12 meter" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.12</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math> relative to equilibrium, as shown, and then released. Friction between the block and surface is negligible.
content.question: As the block passes through the position <math alttext="x equals 0.04 meter" overflow="scroll"> <mi>x</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>0.04</mn> <mspace width="0.25em"> </mspace> <mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi> </math>, what is the kinetic energy of the block?

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
